text: Hi I'd love insight from content marketers specifically if you've hired freelance writers. How much does a writer's SEO abilities factor into your hiring decision? My personal experience as a freelance copywriter is that in B2B, most companies have a separate SEO function and do not rely on writers for it. However, I come across many copywriters who believe they need to be SEO experts and feel insecure about lacking this skill. As a content lead, I am not necessarily looking for SEO expertise as my company has an agency to do the research & provide that data. What has your experience been?

elements.text: Hi I'd love insight from content marketers specifically if you've hired freelance writers. How much does a writer's SEO abilities factor into your hiring decision? My personal experience as a freelance copywriter is that in B2B, most companies have a separate SEO function and do not rely on writers for it. However, I come across many copywriters who believe they need to be SEO experts and feel insecure about lacking this skill. As a content lead, I am not necessarily looking for SEO expertise as my company has an agency to do the research & provide that data. What has your experience been?

text: this may be a better fit in the seo-talk chat but i wasnt sure

elements.text: this may be a better fit in the seo-talk chat but i wasnt sure

text:
For me, it’s not that much - most of the SEO basics are being taken care of when I’m ordering the content piece (in the initial outline brief).

I still ask for SEO experience, because it’s demanding in our niche (imagine that your top 30 competitor brands have at least a 2-person SEO team), but because everyone is so focused on optimization, content writing and especially really good, thought provoking, and unique one has taken a backseat for quite a few brands, this is when a writer who’s really good at it excels more than just someone who knows the SEO basics. Plus as I said, SEO is being taken care of at the brief phase.

elements.text:
For me, it’s not that much - most of the SEO basics are being taken care of when I’m ordering the content piece (in the initial outline brief).

I still ask for SEO experience, because it’s demanding in our niche (imagine that your top 30 competitor brands have at least a 2-person SEO team), but because everyone is so focused on optimization, content writing and especially really good, thought provoking, and unique one has taken a backseat for quite a few brands, this is when a writer who’s really good at it excels more than just someone who knows the SEO basics. Plus as I said, SEO is being taken care of at the brief phase.

text: I hire writers based on SME knowledge or quality of writing. I create the brief and edit accordingly afterwards. No SEO experience needed when the brief is rock solid.

elements.text: I hire writers based on SME knowledge or quality of writing. I create the brief and edit accordingly afterwards. No SEO experience needed when the brief is rock solid.

text: That said, with my latest hire, I did run them through how to use Clearscope as this is a client requirement. They had a basic grasp of SEO and I'm confident our 15 mins sessions was enough to get them up to speed.

elements.text: That said, with my latest hire, I did run them through how to use Clearscope as this is a client requirement. They had a basic grasp of SEO and I'm confident our 15 mins sessions was enough to get them up to speed.

text: Totally agree with Dom. I've shifted to 100% freelance in the past year for my department (except for a social content writer who works under the social dept.) While I have the SEO department create briefs when necessary, I've never had any issues with just hopping on a call and explaining expectations, or showing them how to utilize software. Ok, after writing that I do remember one, but they just weren't up to snuff!

elements.text: Totally agree with Dom. I've shifted to 100% freelance in the past year for my department (except for a social content writer who works under the social dept.) While I have the SEO department create briefs when necessary, I've never had any issues with just hopping on a call and explaining expectations, or showing them how to utilize software. Ok, after writing that I do remember one, but they just weren't up to snuff!

text:
We typically like to hire writers with some SEO knowledge, but it's really all built into how they write. We do all the briefs and SEO research up front, so the extent I need them to understand the concept is just so far as to explain things in a way that is simple enough for Google's NLP to understand.

We also have a comprehensive doc with instructions and help them with understanding how to use Clearscope and the basics of what we expect. Theoretically, a good writer could use the one doc I send and write a kickass piece without ever having a clue what SEO means. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text:

We also have a comprehensive doc with instructions and help them with understanding how to use Clearscope and the basics of what we expect. Theoretically, a good writer could use the one doc I send and write a kickass piece without ever having a clue what SEO means.

text:
Well <@U01MM4EAC69> there’s a big difference between theory and practice, as you found out. Without details I can only speak in generalities.
1. Maybe you’re targeting the wrong persona and thus the traffic you’re getting is unlikely to become a SQL.
2. Maybe you’re attracting the right traffic but failing to guide them through the funnel and turning them into a SQL.
It’s not a case of attracting too much ToF traffic but what you do with it that counts. It’s important and you need it, but it’s just a start.
I’d take stock of what content you have that satisfies MoF and BoF to determine where your gaps exist.

elements.text: Well

Maybe you’re attracting the right traffic but failing to guide them through the funnel and turning them into a SQL.

It’s not a case of attracting too much ToF traffic but what you do with it that counts. It’s important and you need it, but it’s just a start.
I’d take stock of what content you have that satisfies MoF and BoF to determine where your gaps exist.

Narrato Workspace (<https://narrato.io>) was built for such use cases.

You can add agency PoCs/freelancers as team members or maintain a number of workspaces to manage different agencies.

Let me know if you'd like a custom demo of the tool. I work with Narrato, and we would be happy to take you through the software.
